newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Chronology of evolution of Australia euthanasia law.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Chronology of evolution of Australia euthanasia law.

text.p: The following is a chronology of the evolution of the world's first voluntary euthanasia law in Australia's Northern Territory.
An elderly cancer patient, identified by local media as Bob Dent, became the first person to die under the law on Sunday through a computer-assisted lethal injection.
Feb 1, 1995 - Northern Territory Chief Minister (premier) Marshall Perron announces he will introduce private members bill into the territorial Assembly to legalise euthanasia
July 1, 1996 - Euthanasia law comes into force in the Northern Territory
July 24, 1996 - Appeal launched by opponents of the law rejected in Northern Territory Supreme Court
Aug 21, 1996 - Law survives repeal challenge by several members of the Assembly
Sept 9, 1996 - Federal member of parliament Kevin Andrews tables anti-euthanasia private members bill in Parliament
Sept 22, 1996 - Dent dies in assisted suicide
Oct 28, 1996 - Bill to be debated in federal House of Representatives and adjourned to committee hearings
Nov 15, 1996 - Application for special leave to appeal against law by opponents to be heard by the High Court of Australia.
